p: Sulfated compounds isolated from a polysaccharide (MI-S) derived from Agaricus brasiliensis have shown antiherpetic activity against HSV-1 and HSV-2 ( De Sousa Cardozo et al., 2014). MI-S inhibited viral adsorption and penetration into Vero cells and had a synergistic effect with acyclovir ( De Sousa Cardozo et al., 2014). Interestingly, this compound was also shown to reduce the severity of HSV-2 disease in a murine genital infection model with one single application ( Cardozo et al., 2013).
